intro: Blakwellia planiflora, commonly known as the flat-flowered blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, flat, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland regions. Blakwellia planiflora is often found in heathlands and is adapted to tolerate drought and saline conditions.
